element.name: Tonelagee (The Day My World Ended) by Donnacha, Traditional Cache (4/4)
element.long-description:
The day I want to forget.
Located in the Wicklow Gap on Tonelagee mountain. There are a few way to get there, but you can start here: N53 02.498 W6 23.780
This one will be tricky in wet weather. Make sure you bring the usual supplies just in case the weather turns. Tonelagee can be found on OS Map #56. The cache itself is a small tubber box, so if you're trading, you'll have to keep the items small. I have wrapped the cache in a plastic bag and is covered by a rock at the cache location. Best print off the pics just in case you need them.
Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
element.encoded-hints: Go to the stone marker and walk 250ft East. You'll get a group of stones in front of you, some stacked ontop of eash other. The cache is hidden under a stone on the right and is covered by a rock.

ul.li:
2010-05-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by kaputing
Took the easy road up from the south (was going to come across from Mullaghcleevaun but slept in). Weather brilliant if blowy. Easy find, fantastic views. TFTC

2009-03-29T19:00:00Z : Found it by daraconn
Parked at the entrance of Turlough Hill Generating Station, and walked straight up the steep southern slope to the summit. Fairly soft ground at first but conditions improved as we got higher up. To my surprise there were still small patches of snow, including one right at the cache site. The mini-Moro bar was looking mighty tempting so I went ahead and ate it.
After that I headed north to a nearby summit called "Stony Top" and from there continued on to Barrnacullian. The summit of Barrnacullian was an expanse of very soft bog, which made progress difficult. I had an idea of continuing on to Mullaghcleevaun, which was only a couple of kilometres further, but the going got too tough and I had to turn back. Thanks for the cache!

2008-04-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by ginger4x4
This was with no doubt the best one I have done superb views although a "little challenging" to get too :-0 I took the wrong route up but the right route down so would be a good idea to research your route before hand.
It is by the way very well named.
TFTC
ginger4x4

2007-12-28T20:00:00Z : Found it by IrishRambler
Found it with ease, after taking the hint with me. What a day for hiking with a group, very strong winds and very heavy showers, we survived though! In : Moro Bar for the next lucky person who makes it to the top, Out : Czech CD's which the group were intrested in.

2007-11-04T20:00:00Z : Found it by MadraRua
Had a nice hike up here from Glenmacnass with some friends. Overcast but good views and sooooo mild for November. Thanks mate!

wpt.name: GCGT5C
wpt.desc: Tonelagee (The Day My World Ended) by Donnacha, Traditional Cache (4/4)

PKGT5C - Car Park
N 53째 02.504 W 006째 23.565
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Go to the stone marker and walk 250ft East. You'll get a group of stones in front of you, some stacked ontop of eash other. The cache is hidden under a stone on the right and is covered by a rock.

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Took the easy road up from the south (was going to come across from Mullaghcleevaun but slept in). Weather brilliant if blowy. Easy find, fantastic views. TFTC

Parked at the entrance of Turlough Hill Generating Station, and walked straight up the steep southern slope to the summit. Fairly soft ground at first but conditions improved as we got higher up. To my surprise there were still small patches of snow, including one right at the cache site. The mini-Moro bar was looking mighty tempting so I went ahead and ate it.
After that I headed north to a nearby summit called "Stony Top" and from there continued on to Barrnacullian. The summit of Barrnacullian was an expanse of very soft bog, which made progress difficult. I had an idea of continuing on to Mullaghcleevaun, which was only a couple of kilometres further, but the going got too tough and I had to turn back. Thanks for the cache!

This was with no doubt the best one I have done superb views although a "little challenging" to get too :-0 I took the wrong route up but the right route down so would be a good idea to research your route before hand.
It is by the way very well named.
TFTC
ginger4x4

Found it with ease, after taking the hint with me. What a day for hiking with a group, very strong winds and very heavy showers, we survived though! In : Moro Bar for the next lucky person who makes it to the top, Out : Czech CD's which the group were intrested in.
Had a nice hike up here from Glenmacnass with some friends. Overcast but good views and sooooo mild for November. Thanks mate!
